title: Problems patching/installing
body:
Here's the log. Computer is connected to the internet. Download progress on updating the client usually stops at between 2 and 5 percent.

Windows 10

i5 6300 hq
gtx 950m




Starting
--------
> Getting user profile... Done
  - C:\Users\Bill Kakenmaster
> Creating the "LoL Logs" folder... Done

Running ping test
-----------------
Pinging www.google.com [172.217.10.100] with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 172.217.10.100: bytes=32 time=33ms TTL=53
Reply from 172.217.10.100: bytes=32 time=36ms TTL=53
Request timed out.
Reply from 172.217.10.100: bytes=32 time=44ms TTL=53

Ping statistics for 172.217.10.100:
    Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 3, Lost = 1 (25% loss),
Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds:
    Minimum = 33ms, Maximum = 44ms, Average = 37ms

> Saving results to file... Done

Syncing system clock
--------------------
> Starting Time Sync Service... Failed
  /!\ Error: You will need to re-run with admin priviledges
> Resyncing clock... The following error occurred: The service has not been started. (0x80070426)

Gathering logs
--------------
> Generating Process List... Done
> Generating Network Diagnostic... Done
> Generating Graphics Diagnostic... Done
> Copying R3D Logs... Done
> Copying Client Logs... Done
> Copying Network Logs... Done
> Copying RADS Logs... Done
> Copying Launcher Logs... Done
> Copying Patcher Logs... Done
> Copying Maestro Logs... Done
> Copying Game Configuration... Done
> Copying Persisted Settings Configuration... Done

Setting DNS to automatically assigned
-------------------------------------
Finding Network Adapters... Done

> Wi-Fi:
  - Changing to DHCP... Done

Flushing DNS... Done

Reinstalling
------------
> Downloading installer... Failed

Enabling firewall
-----------------
Done

Adding firewall exceptions
--------------------------
> Adding LoL Launcher Firewall Exception... Done
> Adding LoL Patcher Firewall Exception... Done

replies.body:
After looking at that ping test in your logs, it looks like you've got quite a bit of packet loss there (about 25%). Any amount of packet loss can start causing some really weird internet issues, especially ones where you're trying to patch or update. 

Those patching issues might be stemming from that packet loss, which there isn't a whole lot we could do on our since packet loss is mostly caused by your ISP, but there are still a few steps we can take to help push that along. Let's first check up on your [**permissions**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) to make sure everything is configured correctly there to let League update.
